briefTitle: A Multicenter, Open-Label Retreatment Study of the Safety and Effectiveness of PN40082 for Lip Augmentation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. In Protocol PRO 2018-02, the subject was in the per-protocol population, i.e., met all inclusion/exclusion criteria; received study device, completed Visit 5 within the specified window; had LFGS score by the Blinded Evaluating Investigator at Visit 3/Month 2, and had no significant protocol violations that would affect the treatment evaluation.
2. If female and of childbearing potential, a negative urine pregnancy test at Visit 1/Day 1 and the subject agrees to use adequate contraception during the study period
3. Willing to give written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

1\. Women who are pregnant, lactating, or planning a pregnancy

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Lip Fullness Grading Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Lip Fullness Grading Scale is a validated 5-point photonumeric rating scale with 0 being very thin lips (worse outcome) up to 4 full lips (best outcome)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Perioral Lines Severity Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline in the perioral lines rating scale (POL), a 4 point rating scale with 0 as a mouth with no perioral lines (better outcome) to 3 a mouth with many deep lines or crevices (worse outcome).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Patient Global Aesthetic Improvement
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline for the patient Global Aesthetic Improvement scale, a 5 point scale with 1= the appearance is worse than the original condition (worse outcome) up to 5 very much improved optimal cosmetic result (better outcome)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Investigator Global Aesthetic Improvement
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline in the Investigator Global Aesthetic Improvement score, a 5 point scale with 1= the appearance is worse than the original condition (worse outcome) up to 5 = very much improved optimal cosmetic result (better outcome)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Subjects With Decreased Swelling
outcomeMeasures.description: Swelling Assessment at Visit 3/Month 2, a 4 point scale with 0 = no swelling (better outcome) up to 4= Severe Swelling (worse outcome)
